connector.description:
This sink stores documents into ElasticSearch.

Input data must have JSON format according to the index used.

If the *indexId* parameter is set, that value will be used as the document ID on ElasticSearch.

If the *indexId* parameter is not set and the source of the kamelet binding is a Kafka broker, it will take the kafka topic, partition and offset of the
element to generate an automatic ID that warrantees that this element is processed only once.

If the *indexName* parameter is not set and the source of the kamelet binding is a Kafka broker, it will take the kafka topic as the indexName.

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.e.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.enableSSL
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.e.description: Do we want to connect using SSL?

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.h.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.hostAddresses
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.h.description: Comma separated list with ip:port formatted remote transport addresses to use. Example: quickstart-es-http:9200

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.i.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.indexName
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.i.description: The name of the index to act against. Example: data

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.c.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.clusterName
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.c.description: Name of the cluster. Example: quickstart
